alert.note: Alert for Hartley; Oldham (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 5:47AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Oldham and southwestern Hartley Counties through 645 AM CDT... At 547 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Nara Visa, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of western Oldham and southwestern Hartley Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
